entries: You can cast {@spell might of the abyss|Spire of Secrets} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

1: might of the abyss|Spire of Secrets

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Investigator
entries: You can cast the {@spell blood print|Spire of Secrets} spell at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Claw
entries: When you cast a cantrip that requires one or more ranged spell attacks, you can make melee spell attacks instead.

optionalfeature.name: Fell Flight
entries: Your patron grants you the power to fly: this manifests as a pair of wings (of varying designs), a dark aura, or some other sign appropriate to your patron. While you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Lurker in the Threshold
entries: You can cast {@spell protect threshold|Spire of Secrets} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. The spell ends early if you use this invocation to cast the spell again.

optionalfeature.name: Mantle of Mist
entries: You can cast {@spell misty step} without using a spell slot by vanishing into your pact cloak, leaving behind a cloud of smoke. You can use this invocation a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Monstrous Carapace
entries: Your already tough form becomes almost impenetrable. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical weapon that isn't silvered, you can use your reaction to halve the damage taken.

optionalfeature.name: Pale Horse
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell find steed} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Pandemonium Spark
entries: When you roll a 10 on the damage die for your eldritch blast, you can roll an additional d10 and add its damage to the total, rolling again if this die is also a 10, and so on. You can roll a total number of four damage dice for this damage roll, or eight damage dice on a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Sigil of Protection
entries: You can cast {@spell transient bulwark|Spire of Secrets} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest

optionalfeature.name: Sinister Snare
entries: Creatures within your reach provoke opportunity attacks when they leave your reach, even if they took the Disengage action.

optionalfeature.name: Spark of Bedlam
entries: You can cast {@spell frenzy|Spire of Secrets} once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Surge of Chaos
entries: As an action, you can set off an uncontrolled magic spark to cast a random spell. Spend a warlock spell slot and roll on the following table. Each entry gives a list of spells from a particular school of magic; you must choose to cast one of the spells from the list rolled using your warlock spell slot, without consuming expensive material components. New spells are marked with an asterisk.

rows: {@b Abjuration}. {@spell Aid}, {@spell protection from energy}, {@spell stoneskin}, {@spell antilife shell}.
{@b Conjuration}. {@spell Web}, {@spell conjure animals}, {@spell dimension door}, {@spell cloudkill}.
{@b Divination}. {@spell Detect thoughts}, {@spell geomantic discernment|Spire of Secrets}, {@spell divination}, {@spell scrutinize foe|Spire of Secrets}.
{@b Enchantment}. {@spell Suggestion}, {@spell curse of blades|Spire of Secrets}, {@spell confusion}, {@spell hold monster}.
{@b Evocation}. {@spell Gust of wind}, {@spell fireball}, {@spell ice storm}, {@spell wall of force}.
{@b Illusion}. {@spell Mirror image}, {@spell major image}, {@spell greater invisibility}, {@spell seeming}.
{@b Necromancy}. {@spell Ray of enfeeblement}, {@spell bestow curse}, {@spell blight}, {@spell contagion}.
{@b Transmutation}. {@spell Heat metal}, {@spell haste}, {@spell polymorph}, {@spell animate objects}.

optionalfeature.name: Wisp of Shadow
entries: While wearing your pact cloak, you do not take any damage from falling.

optionalfeature.name: Aerodynamic
entries: The weapon's normal range increases by 40 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

item: Masterwork weapon with the Thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Automatic
entries: This weapon gains the Automatic property and its damage decreases by 1 step. The weapon's normal range decreases by 20 feet and its long range decreases accordingly.

{@b Automatic}. When you make an attack with this weapon on your turn, you can choose to make two attacks with disadvantage instead. These attacks always have disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. These attacks use twice the normal amount of ammunition.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Reload property

optionalfeature.name: Balanced
entries: This weapon can be wielded by Small creatures without disadvantage.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon with the Heavy property

optionalfeature.name: Collapsible
entries: This weapon folds down to half its size when not in use.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Concealable
entries: This weapon gains the Concealable property.
{@b Concealable}. While stowed, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to conceal this weapon.

item: Masterwork weapon with the Light property

optionalfeature.name: Elegant
entries: This weapon gains the Elegant property and its damage die increases by one step.
{@b Elegant}. This weapon requires exceptional skill to use. You must have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher to wield an elegant weapon.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Light property or masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Light and Thrown properties

optionalfeature.name: Exotic Weapon
entries: This weapon becomes an exotic weapon and its damage die increases by 1 step.
No class, other than the craftsman, gains proficiency with exotic weapons.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Extended Magazine
entries: The Reload capacity of this weapon is doubled.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Reload property

optionalfeature.name: Finesse
entries: This weapon gains the Finesse property.

item: Masterwork melee weapon that does not have the Two-Handed property or a masterwork ranged weapon that has the Thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Firearm
entries: This weapon becomes a firearm and gains the Firearm property. Its damage die increases by four steps, and moves to two damage dice, if possible.
{@b Firearm}. You don't add your ability score to this weapon's damage rolls. Firearm ammunition can't be recovered once used.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Loading or Reload property that does not have the Tension property

optionalfeature.name: Fist
entries: This weapon gains the Fist property.
{@b Fist}. Attacks made with this weapon are treated as unarmed strikes.

item: Masterwork melee weapon with the Light property

optionalfeature.name: Foregrip
entries: This weapon gains the Foregrip property.
{@b Foregrip}. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. If used in two hands, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that does not have the TwoHanded property

optionalfeature.name: Heavy
entries: This weapon gains the Heavy property. If it is a melee weapon, its damage die increases by 1 step.
If it is ranged, its normal range increases by 20 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Two-Handed property that does not have the Double property

optionalfeature.name: Light
entries: This weapon gains the Light property and its damage die decreases by 1 step.

item: Masterwork weapon that does not have the Two-Handed or Versatile properties

optionalfeature.name: Loading
entries: This weapon gains the Loading property. Its damage die increases by one step.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that does not have the Reload property

optionalfeature.name: Martial
entries: This weapon becomes a martial weapon, and its damage die increases by 1 step.

item: Masterwork simple weapon

optionalfeature.name: Nonleathal
entries: This weapon gains the Nonlethal property.
Nonlethal. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points using this weapon, you can choose to knock the creature out, rendering it unconscious, rather than deal a killing blow.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon

optionalfeature.name: Parrying
entries: This weapon gains the Parrying property and its damage die decreases by 1 step.
{@b Parrying}. While wielding this weapon and not wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC against melee attacks.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Light property

optionalfeature.name: Reach
entries: This weapon gains the Reach property and its damage die decreases by 1 step.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Two-Handed property

optionalfeature.name: Returning
entries: This weapon gains the Returning property.
{@b Returning}. After being thrown, this weapon returns to your hand at the end of your turn.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Light and Thrown properties

optionalfeature.name: Reload
entries: The weapon gains the Reload (5) property. If you apply the Reload property to a martial or exotic weapon with the Mounted property, you can choose to give it the Reload (1, 2 actions) property, and increase its damage by three steps.

{@b Reload}. This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are not proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes an action. If you are proficient, you can reload it as a bonus action. Some weapons require longer to reload, even if you have proficiency, which is specified in the Reload property. If reloading a weapon requires longer than one action, the weapon can't be used to make attacks until reloading is finished.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that does not have the Loading property

optionalfeature.name: Scatter
entries: This weapon gains the Scatter property and its damage die decreases by one step. The weapon's damage die increases by two steps when an attack with it is made against a target within half of its normal range.
The weapon's long range becomes three times the weapon's normal range. The weapon's normal range decreases by 70 feet and its long range decreases by 210 feet.
Scatter. If you make an attack against a target that is within half this weapon's normal range, you deal the damage value listed in parentheses instead of the weapon's normal damage dice.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition and Two-Handed properties that does not have the Sighted property

optionalfeature.name: Sighted
entries: This weapon gains the Sighted property. Additionally, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.
{@b Sighted}. This weapon has disadvantage on attack rolls made against targets within 20 feet.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that does not have the Scatter property

optionalfeature.name: Superheavy
entries: This weapon gains the Superheavy property and its damage die increases by 1 step.
{@b Superheavy}. This weapon is unusually large for its type. You must have a Strength score of 16 or higher to wield a superheavy weapon.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Heavy property

optionalfeature.name: Switch
entries: This weapon gains the Switch property and its damage die decreases by 1 step. You can integrate together two weapons with the Switch property, forming a single unit in which each weapon is one of the unit's two forms. You can choose to use two identical weapons with the Light property for one of the weapon's forms.
{@b Switch}. This weapon has two forms. You can swap between which weapon is being used at any time, even between attacks.

item: Two masterwork exotic weapons

optionalfeature.name: Thrown
entries: This weapon gains the Thrown property with a range of (20/60).

item: Masterwork melee weapon that does not have the Two-Handed property

optionalfeature.name: Trip
entries: This weapon gains the Trip property.
{@b Trip}. You can make a shove attempt against any creature within this weapon's reach. Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks you make to shove a creature using this weapon.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic melee weapon

optionalfeature.name: Two-Handed
entries: This weapon gains the Two-Handed property and its damage die increases by 1 step. Additionally, if it is a ranged weapon, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

item: Masterwork weapon that does not have the Finesse, Foregrip, Light, Thrown, or Versatile properties

optionalfeature.name: Versatile
entries: This weapon gains the Versatile property. While being wielded in two hands, its damage die increases by 1 step

item: Masterwork melee weapon that doesn't have the Light or Two-Handed properties

optionalfeature.name: Blaster Property
entries: This weapon loses the Ammunition, Loading, and Reload properties, as well as any damage die increases associated with these properties. It gains the Blaster property and deals radiant damage instead of its normal type. If this weapon was not previously a firearm, its damage die increases by four steps, and moves to two damage dice, if possible. The weapon's normal range increases by 20 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

{@b Blaster}. A weapon with the Blaster property is a ranged weapon that requires no ammunition. Blasters are considered firearms for the purpose of class features and abilities. Like firearms, you don't add your ability score modifier to blasters' damage rolls.

entries.name: High Tech Settings
entries: In high-tech settings, such as Dark Matter, many weapons release blasts of energy instead of conventional projectiles. The Blaster property replaces the Firearm property in such settings. All rules which apply to firearms apply to blasters as well.
For the purpose of applying masterwork properties, blasters count as ranged weapons with the Ammunition and Reload properties. You can also apply the Overheat and Variable properties to blasters.

item: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Loading or Reload property that does not have the Tension property

optionalfeature.name: Variable
entries: This blaster has a variable power cell. As a bonus action, you can change the damage type of the blaster to cold, fire, lightning, radiant, thunder, or back to its normal damage type.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Blaster property

optionalfeature.name: Brutal
entries: This weapon gains the Brutal property.
{@b Brutal}. This weapon deals two additional dice of damage on a critical hit.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Counterweighted
entries: You can wield this weapon in one hand.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon with the TwoHanded property

optionalfeature.name: Double
entries: This weapon gains the Double property and its damage die decreases by 1 step.

{@b Double}. This weapon has two damage-dealing ends. When you use the Attack action and make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to make an additional attack with it; you do not add your ability modifier to the damage roll of this bonus attack.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon that does not have the Heavy property

optionalfeature.name: Explosive
entries: This weapon gains the Explosive property and its damage die decreases by one step. If this weapon dealt bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, its deals fire damage instead.

{@b Explosive}. When this weapon's projectile hits a target, it explodes in a 5-foot radius. The projectile can be fired at an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature other than the target within the blast radius must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking half the damage rolled on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon

optionalfeature.name: Heat
entries: This weapon gains the Heat property and its damage die increases by 1 step.

{@b Heat}. This weapon gains a heat point whenever an attack is made with it and loses one heat point whenever you begin your turn. If the weapon gains 3 heat points, it overheats and loses all heat points. An overheated weapon can't be used to make an attack again until the end of your next turn.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Firearm property

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: The weapon becomes magical and gains an +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Massive
entries: This weapon gains the Massive property and its damage die increases by 2 steps.

{@b Massive}. You can only make an attack with this weapon when you take the Attack action on your turn. Once you make an attack with this weapon, you can't attack again until the beginning of your next turn. If you would be able to attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn, you deal an additional two dice of damage when using this weapon.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Superheavy property

optionalfeature.name: Mounted
entries: This weapon gains the Mounted property and its damage die increases by 2 steps.

{@b Mounted}. This weapon is normally used while attached to a tripod, vehicle, or other bracing mount. You can mount or unmount this weapon as an action. While it is mounted, it can't be moved. It can only be used to make an attack while unmounted if held by a Medium or larger creature with a Strength score of at least 15.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Heavy property

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: This weapon gains the Precision property.
{@b Precision}. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with this weapon if you have advantage on the attack roll.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Elegant property

optionalfeature.name: Rocket
entries: This weapon gains the Rocket property and its damage die decreases by one step.
{@b Rocket}. This weapon has a small propulsive engine attached to it or its projectiles. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can deal an additional 1d4 damage to the target.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Sniper
entries: The weapon's long range becomes eight times the weapon's normal range.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that does not have the Scatter property

optionalfeature.name: Tension
entries: This weapon gains the Tension property.

{@b Tension}. When making a ranged weapon attack with a tension weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon which does not have the Firearm property

optionalfeature.name: Twinshot
entries: This weapon gains the Twinshot property.

{@b Twinshot}. Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with this weapon, you can make another attack with it against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of the weapon.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon

optionalfeature.name: Overheat
entries: This weapon gains the Overheat property and its damage die increases by 2 steps.
{@b Overheat}. Once you make an attack with this weapon, it can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

item: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Blaster and Heavy properties

optionalfeature.name: Adamantine Weapon
entries: This weapon's damage die increases by two steps, and it deals double damage to objects.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Heavy or Versatile property

optionalfeature.name: Blessed
entries: This weapon deals an additional 1d4 radiant damage on a hit. This additional damage increases to 1d10 radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Earthshatter
entries: This weapon's damage die increases by two steps. On a hit with this weapon, the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone or pushed 10 feet away from you (your choice).

item: Masterwork exotic weapon with the Massive property

optionalfeature.name: Elemental
entries: When you apply this property, choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. This weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage of that type on a hit.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Keen
entries: This weapon scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Versatile property

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: The weapon becomes magical and gains an +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Mithral Weapon
entries: This weapon's damage die increases by 2 steps, and it weighs half as much.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse property

optionalfeature.name: Slaying
entries: When you apply this property, choose one creature type other than humanoids. This weapon deals 1d12 additional damage to creatures of that type.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Serrated
entries: When a creature takes damage from serrated weapons twice or more in a single turn, it takes an additional 1d8 slashing damage.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric
entries: This weapon deals an additional 1d4 necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a hostile creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt with this property.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Venom
entries: This weapon deals an additional 1d8 poison damage on a hit.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Crushing
entries: When you hit a creature that is wearing armor with this weapon, the target's armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. A creature can repair its armor over the course of a long rest.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals bludgeoning damage

optionalfeature.name: Deadly
entries: You can add your ability modifier to the attack and damage rolls of attacks made with this weapon, instead of just attack rolls.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Firearm property

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: The weapon becomes magical and gains an +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon

optionalfeature.name: Penetrating
entries: This weapon pierces through its targets. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, you can attack all creatures in a straight line within this weapon's normal range; each creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's damage.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon with the Ammunition or Thrown property that deals piercing damage

optionalfeature.name: Seeking
entries: When you make an Attack that does not have disadvantage with this weapon and miss, you instead hit the target and deal 5 damage. Do not add additional damage or increase this damage total, regardless of circumstance.

item: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon

optionalfeature.name: Swift
entries: This weapon can be used to attack blindingly fast. When you use the Attack action and make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to make an additional attack. If you engage in two-weapon fighting with two swift weapons, you can make two attacks, instead of one, as a bonus action.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Elegant property

optionalfeature.name: Threatening
entries: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use this weapon to make an attack against it without using your reaction.

item: Masterwork exotic melee weapon

optionalfeature.name: Vorpal
entries: When you Attack a creature with this weapon and score a critical hit, that target takes an extra 4d8 slashing damage. Then roll another d20. If you roll a 20 on the second roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the GM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.

item: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage

optionalfeature.name: Cleated
entries: While wearing this armor, when you would be involuntarily moved by an effect, reduce that movement by 10 feet.

item: Suit of masterwork medium or heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Climbing
entries: This armor is outfitted with integrated climbing gear. While wearing this armor, as long as you have one hand free, you gain a climb speed equal to your movement speed.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Comfortable
entries: You can sleep in this suit of armor with no ill effect.

item: Suit of masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Environmental
entries: While wearing this suit of armor, you can ignore detrimental effects of temperatures as low as -100 degrees or as high as 300 degrees.

item: Suit of masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Exotic Armor
entries: This armor becomes exotic armor and gains a +1 to its AC.
No class, other than the craftsman, gains proficiency with exotic armor.

item: Suit of masterwork armor that isn't exotic

optionalfeature.name: Integrated
entries: You can integrate a weapon directly into your armor, or you can integrate two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has the Two-Handed property. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. When you stow it, it retracts back into your armor. You can switch which weapons are integrated over the course of a long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Quick-Change
entries: You can don or doff this suit of armor as an action.

item: Suit of masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Retractable
entries: One of the gauntlets on this suit of armor has a retractable shield set into it. While wearing this armor, you can don or doff this shield as a bonus action.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork medium or heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Scaled
entries: This armor is covered in heavy, hardened scales. The AC provided by this armor increases by 3, but its maximum Dexterity bonus becomes +2.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Spiked
entries: This suit of armor is bristling with spikes. While wearing this armor, creatures who are in contact with you (either by grappling you, being grappled by you, or having swallowed you whole) take piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier at the start of your turn.

item: Suit of masterwork heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Adamantine Armor
entries: This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Arcane
entries: This armor is covered in arcane etchings. When you apply this property to a suit of armor, choose two cantrips from the wizard spell list. While wearing this armor, you can cast those cantrips. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for these cantrips.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Arrow-Catching
entries: Whenever an attacker makes a ranged attack against a target within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to become the target of the attack instead.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork medium or heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Diving
entries: This suit of armor is equipped with webbed fins, a mask, and an air bladder containing 8 hours of breathable air. While wearing it, you gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed. Additionally, while breathing from the air bladder, you can breathe normally underwater or in a vacuum, and you ignore the effects of breathable poisons. The suit's air supply can be refilled over the course of a long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: This suit of armor is fitted with massive plates and a heavy, reinforced helmet. While wearing this armor, you count as an obstacle providing three-quarters cover, instead of half cover. You must have a Strength score of 16 or higher to proficiently wear this armor.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Maneuvering
entries: This armor contains a set of spring loaded, automatically retracting grappling hooks, allowing you an incredible amount of maneuverability. As a reaction when you fall, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can project a grappling hook at a target location you can see within your movement speed. If the target location can hold your weight, you are pulled there, expending movement normally. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. You must have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher to use this ability.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light or medium armor

optionalfeature.name: Mithral Armor
entries: This suit of armor is made of mithral, a light and flexible metal that is as strong as steel. Armor made of mithral weighs half as much as normal, has no Strength requirement, and does not impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the armor is medium,  the maximum Dexterity modifier to AC you can apply increases to 3, instead of 2, and the armor can easily be worn hidden under normal clothing.

item: Suit of masterwork medium or heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Resistance
entries: When you apply this property to a suit of armor, choose any damage type other than psychic. While wearing this armor, you gain resistance to that damage type.

item: Suit of masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Animated
entries: This armor is enchanted with powerful transmutation magic. As an action, you can doff your armor, which animates, becoming a {@item Animated Object (Medium)|phb|medium animated object}, as per the spell {@spell animate objects}. The armor's AC is equal to your own while wearing it. If you were holding a weapon when the armor animates, it makes one attack using that weapon using your attack bonus instead of its Multiattack. The armor remains animated for 1 minute or until it is reduced to 0 HP, at which time it becomes inanimate. You can end this effect early by using your action to command your animated armor to return to you (if it is within 25 feet of you) and be donned as inanimate armor once again. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

item: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Cloaking
entries: This armor can easily hide the wearer when needed. While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell invisibility} spell without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Clockwork
entries: This suit of armor has dozens of clockwork mechanisms integrated into it, granting you a number of benefits. While wearing this armor, your jump distance triples, and you gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks (other than grappling checks). Additionally, your armor locks down when you take the Dodge action, causing your AC to become 22, if it were lower.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Glamoured
entries: This armor does not impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. You can also use a bonus action to cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this ability again or remove the armor.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Trollskin
entries: This suit of armor is made of or is lined with troll skin. While wearing this armor, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your craftsman level. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork medium armor

optionalfeature.name: Winged
entries: This armor has a set of wings that you can extend from it or fold back into it as a bonus action. While wearing this armor with the wings extended, you have a flight speed equal to your movement speed.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Colossal
entries: This suit of armor doubles in scale when donned. While wearing this armor, you gain the Enlarge effect of the enlarge/reduce spell.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Etherealness
entries: This suit of armor is infused with ectoplasm. While wearing this armor, you can use your action to gain the effects of the etherealness spell which last for 10 minutes or until you use an action to deactivate it. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Fleet
entries: This armor is designed to maximize the wearer's speed. While wearing this armor, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, you have advantage on initiative rolls, and opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Immortal
entries: Whenever you drop to 0 hit points and don't die outright, you can make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, you have advantage on death saving throws.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork medium or heavy armor

optionalfeature.name: Mirrored
entries: While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@soekk mirror image} spell without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork light armor

optionalfeature.name: Spellguard
entries: This armor is covered in protective sigils and charms. While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against spells.

item: Suit of exotic masterwork armor

optionalfeature.name: Warding
entries: This suit of armor generates a field of force, protecting its wearer from harm. As a bonus action on your turn, you can gain temporary hit points equal to half your craftsman level.

item: Suit of exotic medium masterwork armor

entries: If you hit a plant creature with this weapon, the plant takes an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the weapon's type. This weapon ignores the damage threshold of objects made of wood, vines, or other naturally grown materials.

While wearing this armor, you can use your action to cast {@spell fireball|phb} (DC 15), centered on yourself. You take no damage from this spell. The armor can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Adamantine Polish
entries: This abrasive paste can be applied as an action to the claws, fangs, tusks, or spines of a creature to make them sharper, harder, or cleaner. For 8 hours after application, that creature gains a +1 to attack and damage rolls with its natural weapons, which count as being made of adamantine for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance and immunity.

item.name: Alchemical Anesthetic
entries: This clear, odorless potion is housed in a wickedlooking syringe, which contains 4 doses. You can administer the anesthetic to a willing creature as an action, dulling its nerves and making it impossible for them to feel pain for one hour. An aestheticized creature has advantage on Constitution checks and saving throws and can't be {@condition incapacitated} or have disadvantage on rolls due to being in pain. However, the creature is unaware of how much pain they are in or how many levels of {@condition exhaustion} they have. If a player character is aestheticized, the GM tracks the character's hit points and levels of {@condition exhaustion} instead of the player for the duration.
If you administer a dose over the course of a minute to a willing or {@condition unconscious} creature, you can render the creature {@condition unconscious} for one hour.

If you continue to slowly administer anesthetic (one dose every eight hours), you can keep a creature {@condition unconscious} for up to 24 hours; keeping a creature {@condition unconscious} longer than this results in death.

item.name: Antimagic Bell
entries: This round bell is enchanted to be perfectly silent.
It only rings when its magic is disrupted, such as within an antimagic field.

item.name: Aqua Fortis
entries: This transparent acid constantly bubbles within its sealed vial. As an action, you can throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack, treating the vial as an improvised weapon.

If the target is an object that isn't being worn or carried, the acid dissolves a 1-foot cube of the object. If splashed on a suit of armor or a shield, the object takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. If splashed on a weapon, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. It has no effect on magic items and objects made of gold, glass, stone, or adamantine.

If the target is a creature, it takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage, followed by an additional {@damage 2d6} acid damage at the end of its next turn and another {@damage 1d6} acid damage at the end of the turn after that. The aqua fortis can be washed off with one gallon of water, ending the effect early.

item.name: Arrow of Explosions
entries: When this arrow strikes a solid surface, be it a creature, object, wall or floor, it explodes with a fiery blast. Each creature within 20 feet of the point of impact must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw.
A creature takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The arrow is destroyed in the blast.

item.name: Arrow of Glue
entries: An arrow of glue is one of a few arrows known as trick arrows. When you fire an arrow of glue, the arrow's shaft becomes plastic on impact and hardens immediately after. You can fire this area at any point you can see within range to cover a

1-square foot area with hardened glue. The GM may rule that especially challenging shots are made with disadvantage. A creature hit by this arrow must succeed a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be glued to the floor, unable to move. It can break free with a successful DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

item.name: Arrow of Piercing
entries: An arrow of piercing is one of a few arrows known as trick arrows. When you make an attack with this arrow, it becomes a 5-foot wide line of magical energy that extends out from you to the weapon's normal range. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes the weapon's normal damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The arrow is then destroyed.

item.name: Arrow of Teleportation
entries: An arrow of teleportation is one of a few arrows known as trick arrows. When this arrow is fired from a bow at an unoccupied space within 100 feet of the archer, the archer immediately teleports to its location. The arrow is destroyed on impact.

item.name: Aura Lenses
entries: {@i uncommon (incomplete) or rare (complete)}

A set of these large glass lenses are contained in a single cylindrical case. Each is four inches across, tinted different hues, and associated with a particular school of magic, as shown on the Arcane

School Colors table. When you hold a lens up to your eye and look through it, the world appears to be tinted in the appropriate color, except for creatures and objects which are under the effect of a spell from the lens's associated school of magic, which are not colored at all.
A complete set of aura lenses contains all 8 individual lenses, but most are found as an incomplete set, containing only {@dice 1d8} of them.

item.name: Bedroll of Rest
entries: This enchanted, silken bedroll is immensely comfortable. Sleeping in it during a long rest removes all levels of {@condition exhaustion} and restores all expended hit dice. After sleeping in it, you do not require rest for 48 hours, though you can still choose to take a long rest during that time.

item.name: Bells of Due Alarm
entries: This trio of bells warns you of intruders. You can arrange the bells up to 500 feet apart from each other, and use your action to speak a command word to cast the {@spell alarm} spell, warding the area between the bells.

item.name: Blindfold of True Darkness
entries: You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover. Moreover, you can see an {@condition invisible} creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This blindfold is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. While cursed, you are {@condition blinded}, whether or not you are wearing the blindfold.

item.name: Boots of the Hare
entries: While attuned to these boots, whenever you use your action to {@action Dash}, you gain 90 feet of extra movement instead of the usual amount.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: These boots are cursed. a fact that is revealed only when an identify spell is cast on the boots or you attune to them. Attuning to the boots curses you until you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. While cursed, your base movement speed is 15 feet and can't be increased by any means.

item.name: Boots of the Trail
entries: Until they are worn, the boots of the trail appear to be in grave disrepair. When you attune to them, the illusion fades: they are immaculate hiking boots, with gold clasps and silk laces. While wearing these boots, you leave behind no tracks or other traces of your passage and you can't be tracked except by magical means. You can march for twice as long before suffering levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

Additionally, you can remove the boots and speak a command word as an action to cause the boots to walk alone, leaving a false trail in any direction for up to one mile. Then, the boots teleport back to your feet.

item.name: Brawling Gloves +1
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, fighter, or rogue
entries: While attuned to these fingerless magical gloves, you have proficiency in all improvised weapons and gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using them.

item.name: Brawling Gloves +2
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, fighter, or rogue
entries: While attuned to these fingerless magical gloves, you have proficiency in all improvised weapons and gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using them.

item.name: Brawling Gloves +3
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, fighter, or rogue
entries: While attuned to these fingerless magical gloves, you have proficiency in all improvised weapons and gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using them.

item.name: Burning Knuckles
entries: While attuned to these magical gauntlets, your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 2d6} fire damage instead of their usual damage die.

item.name: Cane of Youth
entries: While attuned to this cane, you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can't be aged magically.
You can still die of old age, however.

item.name: Chameleon Concoction
entries: When you drink this potion, your skin camouflages to match the color and texture of your surroundings, granting your advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks you make to avoid being seen for 1 hour. This liquid's hue rapidly shifts to match whatever material it is nearest to.

item.name: Coil of Strength Storing
entries: This metallic coil is usually worn on an arm, leg or other appendage. While attuned to it, whenever you make a melee weapon attack roll that beats the target's AC by 5 or more, the coil gains 1 stored charge. It can hold up to 5 charges at a time. You can then expend any number of stored charges to gain a bonus on an attack roll you make with a melee weapon equal to the number of charges expended.
Unused changes disappear 1 minute after being stored.

item.name: Cure-All
entries: The cure all contains {@dice 1d4 + 1} doses of potent medicine. A creature can drink a dose as an action, curing it of any disease, ending its poisoning, and causing it to be immune to being {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. A complex swirl of red liquid in the potion's center resembles a snake on a pole. Shaking the bottle fails to mix the colors.

item.name: Dowsing Rod
entries: This forked stick is used to discover water. It has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding this rod, you can use your action and expend a charge to cause the rod to point to the largest source of water in a 10-mile radius.
The rod does not indicate the distance or quantity of water. If there is little to no water to be found, the rod indicates vaguely downward, for there is always some amount of water underground.

item.name: Drum of Blasted Beats
entries: This drum has 6 charges. While attuned to it, you can use an action to strike it and expend one charge to cast the {@spell thunderwave} spell or two charges to cast the {@spell shatter} spell (spell save DC 15).
The drum regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dusk. If you expend the drum's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the drum ruptures and loses its magic.

item.name: migr Manuscript
entries: This ancient tome is shaped like a skull and smells of either violets or tiger lilies. While holding the tome, you can cast the spell {@spell resurrection}. Once the manuscript is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: The migr Manuscript is cursed to bring nothing but misery to those who would use it.
Whenever you use it to raise the dead, roll a {@dice d20} to determine the result according to the table below.

rows: The spell fails and the caster immediately dies.
The target is resurrected as a revenant, seeking revenge against the caster.
The target is resurrected as a ghost, but otherwise retains their memories and personality.
The spell works, but the 100 humanoids nearest to the target (excluding the caster) immediately die.
The spell works, but the caster must roll twice on the Indefinite Madness table, suffering both results. If the same result is rolled twice, the caster immediately dies.
The spell works, but the target loses all of their memories, class levels, proficiencies (including languages), and personality traits.
The spell appears to work, but the target dies again after 1d10 minutes. No magic short of a wish can revive them from this death.

item.name: Folding Ladder
entries: This item appears as two short wooden rods,, 12 inches long and 1 inch in diameter, connected sideby- side. It weighs four lb. It has three command words.

When you speak the ladder's first command word, it expands into a ladder, 2 feet wide and 20 feet long. If you speak the second command word, it extends into a freestanding stepladder, 30 feet high with a base that is 5 feet by 10 feet. The third command word causes the ladder to collapse back into its folded form.
The ladder can support 500 lb. of weight in either of its extended configurations.

item.name: Gambler's Coin
entries: This ordinary looking gold piece has deep scratches on one side. It has 3 charges. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw while holding it, you can expend 1 charge to instead replace the {@dice d20} roll with a coin flip. On heads, the roll is treated as a 20 (though you do not score a critical hit with an attack roll or activate any other effects which trigger on the roll of a 20), and on tails, the roll is treated as a 1. The coin regains all expended charges at dawn.

item.name: Gaol Net
entries: When a Large or smaller creature is {@condition restrained} with this magical net, you can use your action to speak its command word, causing the net to transform into a Large iron cage that encloses the target. The enclosed creature is no longer {@condition restrained}.

The cage weighs 500 lb. and is fitted with a locked door (DC 15 to pick the lock). A creature, including the one enclosed in the cage, can use an action to make a DC 25 Strength check to bend the bars enough to let a creature out. If the cage is empty, you can use an action to speak a command word, causing it to transform back into a net.
Once the net transforms into a cage, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Gloves of Skill
entries: While attuned to these gloves, you have proficiency with one tool or instrument. The DM chooses the proficiency or determines it randomly from the options below.

item.name: Hand of Glory
entries: This mummified hand is worn around the neck with a leather cord. While attuned to the hand, you gain two additional attunement slots for magic rings, which are placed on the hand's digits. If your attunement with the hand ends, your attunement with the magic rings worn on it also ends.

item.name: Invisible Ink
entries: Anything written in this ink is {@condition invisible}. A DC 25 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check reveals that there is writing present, but not what it says. Only creatures that have {@sense truesight} or are under the effect of the see invisibility spell can read text written in this ink, though the invisibility effect can be removed using dispel magic. One pot is sufficient to write 250 words or draw one picture or diagram.

item.name: Tome of Tongues
entries: This book contains grammar and vocabulary for a specific language, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 8 hours over a period of 2 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, you learn to read, write and speak whatever language it concerns. The tome then loses its magic forever.

item.name: Lady and Lord Rings
entries: These two rings, one engraved with the image of a mighty lord and the other with a stately lady, are part of a matched set. Two creatures can attune to the rings, each wearing one of the rings. While within 30 feet of each other, both attuned creatures have resistance to all damage. Also while both creatures are within 30 feet of each other, each time an attuned creature takes damage, the other creature takes the same amount of damage. Attunement to these rings breaks if either attuned creature drops to 0 hit points or breaks attunement.

item.name: Locket of Remembrance
entries: When a locket of remembrance is created, it is engraved with the name and likeness of a creature that has died. It is then dedicated to this creature. As long as the locket is worn by a living creature, the creature's remains can't become undead and its soul can't linger as an undead creature.

item.name: Loincloth of Oni Magic
entries: While attuned to this blood-red loincloth, you can cast and concentrate on any spells you know, even while you are raging.

Furthermore, the loincloth has 6 charges. While attuned to it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells (spell save DC 17): charm person (1 charge), sleep (1 charge), darkness (2 charges), invisibility (2 charges), gaseous form (3 charges), or cone of cold (4 charges).
The loincloth regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at sunset.

item.name: Marvelous Painted World
entries: This masterful painting, at least a 5-foot square in area, was crafted by a master painter using at least ten pots of marvelous pigments. It depicts a serene painted world. The painting itself acts as a portal to a demiplane in which the painted world exists, and is large enough to allow Medium creatures to pass through unhindered. Inside the painted world, a portal is a misty archway to the real world. If the painting is rolled up or faced toward a solid surface, the portal disappears inside the painted world.

The location, objects, and creatures depicted within the painted world are determined by the painting's creator, but such objects and creatures can't leave the painted world, as they can't pass through the portal and disappear into smoke if removed from the demiplane by other means. Time passes at half speed within the painted world, and you don't need to eat or drink while within it.

item.name: Necromantic Draught
entries: Pouring this potion on a Medium or Small humanoid corpse causes the effect of the animate dead spell for 24 hours. You command undead animated in this way. This brightly glowing neonyellow goo is repelled away from living things which touch its container.

item.name: Ooze Bottle
entries: As an action, you can throw this vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact and releasing a {@creature gray ooze}.
This ooze is friendly to you and your allies and will otherwise attack the nearest creature it can detect.

If there is no creature to attack, the ooze will follow you. However, the biochemistry of this ooze is unstable, and the ooze dissolves into a lifeless sludge after one hour. The charcoal-colored liquid inside this bottle seems to lunge about with unnatural momentum.

item.name: Parchment of Sending
entries: This parchment can hold a message of twenty-five words or less; additional text is magically erased.

When addressed with the name of a creature with which you are familiar, the parchment folds itself into the shape of a glider and flutters on the wind, magically seeking out the creature within 24 hours if the recipient is on the same plane of existence as you. The recipient can write an additional twentyfive word message and cause the parchment to fold itself and return to you by addressing your name.
The parchment can make four such trips, and then becomes mundane parchment

item.name: Phase Arrow
entries: This ethereal arrow passes through all matter except the intended target. You ignore all cover, including full cover, when making an attack with this arrow.
This arrow can target creatures on the Ethereal Plane as if they were on the Material Plane, and vice versa. Once it hits a target, the arrow is no longer magical.

item.name: Polymorph Potion
entries: When you drink this potion, which is a purple liquid derived from mimic blood, you gain the effects of the polymorph spell. Roll a {@dice d20} and consult the following table to determine the form you are transformed into.

item.name: Portable Cannonballs
entries: This bag contains twenty iron balls, each one inch in diameter and weighing 1/4 lb. As a bonus action, the command word can be spoken, which causes any number of the balls to expand into full-size cannonballs weighing 10 lb. each, suitable for firing from a cannon.

The bag can be poured out on the ground as an action, in which case it functions exactly as a bag of ball bearings. If the command word is spoken after the bag is poured out, all the balls expand at once. If a bag full of expanded balls is set to rolling, such as by being poured down a hill, any creature in the path of the balls must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage.
Individual iron balls can be fired from a sling and expanded in midair, dealing {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage on a hit, though any attacks made in this fashion have disadvantage.

item.name: Portal Chalk
entries: Each of these two pieces of chalk radiate a different luminescent aura; one orange, the other blue. Each piece of this chalk has 10 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of a piece of chalk to draw a circular or rectangular portal on a solid stone surface large enough for a Medium creature. This portal instantly becomes linked to the most recent portal drawn with the other color of chalk, unlinking any portals other than these two. A linked portal is a glowing ring or rectangle filled with opaque mist; an unlinked portal is simply mundane chalk. A pair of linked portals act as a magical gate. Any creature or object entering a linked portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other; passing through a portal from the nonportal side has no effect.

item.name: Potion of Mirrored Eyes
entries: For 1 minute after you drink this potion, you gain immunity to any effect which can normally be avoided by averting your gaze from it, such as a medusa's petrifying gaze. While under the influence of this potion, you can safely look at such creatures without being subjected to their abilities.

item.name: Puzzle Box
entries: Though a magic item in and of itself, this cubic box often contains far more powerful and destructive items. The puzzle box can hold one cubic foot of contents, which can't be targeted by divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors created by divination spells.

Once the box is closed, it can only be opened by solving the box's puzzle. You can attempt to solve it by spending 24 hours working on the puzzle mechanism, after which you must succeed a DC 23 Intelligence check to open the box. You can close the box as an action, automatically scrambling the puzzle.

item.name: Replacement Man
entries: If damage would reduce you to 0 hit points while you are attuned to this item, you drop to 1 hit point instead and the replacement man fades away with a sad smile on his face.

item.name: Replica Clay
entries: When you touch this lump of clay to an object that can fit within a 5-foot cube, the clay shifts and molds into an exact replica, with the same color and texture. The replica even mimics visual magical elements, such as glowing runes, present on the object. Touching the replica reveals it to be made of clay, as it yields under any significant force, but it is impossible to distinguish with a visual inspection.
Once the clay is shaped into a replica, it becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Reverberating Shield
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. Whenever a creature misses you with a melee weapon attack while you are holding this shield, it must succeed a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature drops its weapon, which is thrown 15 feet away from you. If the weapon can't be dropped, such as a dragon's bite or claws, the attacker instead has disadvantage on all weapon attacks until the end of its turn.

item.name: Ring of Barrels
entries: This ring has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can use an action and expend 1 to 3 of its charges to summon a number of empty barrels in spaces adjacent to you equal to the number of charges expended. The barrels are large, fully 6-feet high and 4-feet in diameter, occupying the same space as a Medium creature and providing three-quarters cover from ranged attacks. Barrels weigh 150 pounds and can be moved with an action.

You can summon the barrel around {@condition incapacitated} Medium creatures, restraining them, or around Small or smaller creatures, trapping them inside. A creature can break free of a barrel by making a DC 22 Strength check.

item.name: Ring of Salvation
entries: If you fail a saving throw while attuned to this ring, you can choose to succeed it instead. Once you have used this ability, you can't use it again for 24 hours.

item.name: Sandstone Solution
entries: You can pour this substance on the ground as an action. If poured onto stone, a 10-foot deep, 10-foot radius of the stone becomes soft mud for 1 hour.

When poured into mud, sand, or quicksand, a 10-foot deep, 10-foot radius region of the material become solid stone for 1 hour. The stone has 75 HP, 17 AC, and immunity to psychic and poison damage. Any creature inside it when it becomes stone must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature can break free by succeeding on a DC 20 Strength check or by dealing 25 damage to the stone. This sandlike substance flows about its container like a fluid.

item.name: Scroll of Duplication
entries: This blank scroll is imbued with enchantments that enable it to copy text from another source. As an action, you can touch the scroll of duplication to an object that contains writing. The scroll instantaneously copies up to 500 consecutive words from the source material (you can choose which section if the source material is longer than this), creating a perfect duplicate of the original text. The scroll only copies nonmagical text, not illustrations or magical writings (such as the contents of a spellbook or a glyph of warding). If the source contains a mixture of magical writing, illustrations, and nonmagical text, only the nonmagical text is copied, leaving blank space where illustrations and magical writing would be expected. Using the scroll does not activate magical traps that trigger upon reading the source material.

item.name: Smoking Pipe of Dragon's Breath
entries: This pipe has 2 charges and regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn. If the pipe is full of one ounce of smoking herb, you can inhale deeply and use an action to expend 1 charge and exhale dragon's flame while holding it. Each creature in a 30-foot radius cone must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Sorting Beast
entries: The sorting beast is a six-legged construct with eyes, legs, and antennae at both ends and an array of measuring devices near its center. It can manipulate and hold objects up to 30 pounds in weight.

When activated as an action, the sorting beast sets about collecting and sorting all loose valuable items within 100 feet. It sorts all gold pieces, silver pieces, and copper pieces into neat stacks of 10. For material goods, such as precious stones, the sorting beast can appraise value by weight and quality, before sorting the goods appropriately and printing the result on a fine paper strip. The sorting beast continues sorting until finished or deactivated as an action.
Additionally, the sorting beast can cast the spell {@spell identify}, without using material components, on one object you designate each day.

item.name: Totem of Enmity
entries: This wooden rod is engraved with evil symbols and hateful curses in all languages. As an action, you can break the rod while speaking the name of a creature you are familiar with to swear vengeance against that creature. You indefinitely have advantage on attack rolls against the named creature. This effect ends if you break another totem of enmity or the creature dies.

item.name: Troll Rod
entries: This uncouth pommel has a troll's arm attachedstill livingto one end. As a bonus action, you can issue it commands in the troll-dialect of giant to pick up items, drop them, or make a fist (typical command words include "grabbit", "leggo", and "maik'a'fist".) If closed into a fist, the rod acts as a magic mace, and you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using it.

item.name: Universal Knocker
entries: You can use your action to hold this brass door knocker against an object to cast the {@spell knock} spell targeting the object. The knocker can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bat Charm
entries: This obsidian charm appears like a shrieking bat. While attached, when you deal damage to a creature with this weapon, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Blade Charm
entries: This adamantine charm is shaped like a miniature longsword. While attached, you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This bonus does not apply to magical weapons that already have a bonus to attack and damage rolls.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Die Charm
entries: This silver charm depicts a six-sided die. While attached, the weapon deals more potent critical hits. When you score a critical hit, if you roll the maximum number of any damage die, you can roll an additional damage die and add its damage to the total, rolling again if this die is also the maximum number, and so on. You can roll a total number of damage dice for this critical hit equal to twice the number of damage dice you initially rolled.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Ghost Charm
entries: This crystal charm is carved into the shape of a wispy spirit. While attached, the weapon can affect creatures on the Ethereal Plane as if they were on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Hook Charm
entries: This bronze charm is shaped like a fishing hook. When attached, if the weapon is on the same plane of existence, you can use your bonus action to teleport it to your hand.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Feather Charm
entries: This gold charm of a feather feels unusually light. While attached, this weapon weighs half as much as usual. Small creatures can effectively use the weapon, even if it has the Heavy property.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Lance Charm
entries: This copper charm depicts a short lance. While attached, once on each of your turns when you make a melee attack with this weapon against a creature you can see, you can lunge up to 15 feet toward your target before making the attack. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. You can perform this movement even if it causes you to travel through the air, though you fall after making the attack if you do not land on solid ground.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Lightning Bolt Charm
entries: This mithral charm depicts a wild lightning bolt. While attached, this weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to any target it hits.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Mirror Charm
entries: This shiny platinum charm depicts an elegant hand mirror. This charm can only be attached to a weapon with the Light property.

When attached, when you draw the weapon with one hand, a spectral duplicate of the weapon appears in your other hand. This spectral duplicate has identical statistics to the original weapon, including its magical effects, but doesn't include ammunition. When the attached weapon or its spectral duplicate leaves your hand, the duplicate vanishes.

A weapon charm is a small ornament fixed on a loop of string or chain. You can use your action to attach the charm on a weapon, usually on the weapon's pommel, causing the weapon to become a magic weapon that requires attunement. Even if the weapon was already magical, you must attune to it again to gain the charm's magical benefits, which are listed in the charm's description. A weapon can only have one charm attached at a time.

item.name: Wooden Coin of Lies
entries: While attuned to this coin, you are constantly under the effect of the glibness spell.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This coin is cursed; attuning to it extends its curse to you. You can only break attunement to the coin with the remove curse spell or similar magic. While attuned to the coin, you can't deliberately speak the truth. You can be evasive in your wording, lie by omission, or speak halftruths, as long as your words remain within the boundaries of deception.

item.name: Craftsman's Tools
additionalEntries: As a craftsman, you carry a set of craftsman's tools, a combined toolkit which covers a broad range of applications. You can use a set of craftsman's tools for any ability check you would make with any set of artisan's tools. A set of craftsman's tools costs 75 gp.

item.name: Amphibious Adaptation
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Amphibious trait
{@b Slot:} Head
You have grafted the gills of an aquatic creature to your neck, allowing you to breathe both air and water. Additionally, you attach minimal fins and gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed.

item.name: Arcane Synapses
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Innate Spellcasting feature
{@b Slot:} Head

You have stolen a bit of arcane potential from a creature by inserting some of its nerves into your brain. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your casting ability for this cantrip.
By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft and learn an additional wizard cantrip.

item.name: Beast's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast of Large size or larger
{@b Slot:} External
You have transplanted the thick (and possibly furry) hide from a wild beast onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Bestial Weapons
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast, Dragon, Monstrosity with Bite or Claw attack
{@b Slot:} Arms or Head

You have surgically implanted the teeth or claws from a monster into yourself, granting yourself a host of ferocious weapons. By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft to gain both the claws and teeth.

You can use your claws and teeth to make unarmed strikes, and can use Dexterity instead of Strength for their attack and damage rolls. If you hit with your claws or teeth, you deal damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Your claws deal slashing damage and take up the Arms slot, whereas your teeth deal piercing damage and take up the Head slot.

item.name: Charging Hooves
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Charge trait or a Gore or Hooves attack
{@b Slot:} Legs

You have replaced your legs with those of a creature known for running down their foes. Once on each of your turns, when you move at least 15 feet in a straight line, you can move up to 10 additional feet in that direction without spending additional movement.

item.name: Climbing Apparatus
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast, Humanoid, or Monstrosity with a climb speed
{@b Slot:} Legs
You have replaced or complemented your limbs with those of a climbing creature. You gain a climb speed equal to your movement speed.

item.name: Darkvision
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with darkvision
{@b Slot:} Head

You have replaced your own eyes with those of a monster with keen vision. You gain darkvision, the ability to see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

item.name: Draconis Fundamentum
entries: {@b Donor:} Humanoid, Dragon, or Monstrosity with a Breath weapon
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have installed the mighty source of breath weapons into yourself, and as an action on your turn, you can exhale a wave of energy. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 damage for each point of your proficiency bonus, or half as much on a successful one. The breath's damage is the same type as the donor's breath weapon.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Dragon's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Dragon of Large size or larger
{@b Slot:} External

You've transplanted the scaly, diamondlike hide of a dragon onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 17. You also gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor dragon was immune: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. You can only install this graft if you are proficient with heavy armor

item.name: Energetic Suture
entries: {@b Donor:} Celestial, Dragon, Elemental, or Fiend with resistance to fire, cold, lightning, or poison damage
{@b Slot:} External

You have managed to capture the essence of extraplanar resistance to magic. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor was immune or resistant: fire, cold, lightning, or poison damage.

item.name: Heart of Steel
entries: {@b Donor:} Any construct
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have replaced your heart with the core from a construct. As a result, you can ignore the effects of 1 level of exhaustion, and you only need to rest for 4 hours to gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

item.name: Horns
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Gore, Horns, Ram, or Tusk attack
{@b Slot:} Head

You attach a study pair or horns or tusks onto your body. You can use your horns to make unarmed strikes, which deal damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike. Your horns deal the same type of damage as the donor (usually bludgeoning or piercing damage). Additionally, if you move in a straight line for 10 feet immediately before hitting a creature with your horns, that creature must make an opposed Strength check or be knocked prone.

item.name: Fiend's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Fiend of Medium size or larger
{@b Slot:} External
You have transplanted the supernaturally tough hide of a fiend onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 15 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum 2).

item.name: Flexible Form
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the shapechanger subtype
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have alchemically transfused the blood of a shapechanger into yourself. You can change your form as per the spell {@spell alter self} (to use only the Change Appearance option), targeting only yourself and requiring no spell slots, spell components, or concentration.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Indiscernible Anatomy
entries: {@b Donor:} Aberration
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have spliced aberrant genetics into your body, which have subsequently altered the placement and composition of your internal organs. When you are targeted by an attack that is a critical hit, you can choose to take no additional damage from critical hit, as if it were a normal hit instead.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Leaping Legs
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Pounce or Standing Leap trait
{@b Slot:} Legs

You have replaced or modified your legs with the muscular limbs of a bounding creature. Your long jump distance and your high jump height double. Additionally, you can jump your full distance with or without a running start.

item.name: Olfactory Implants
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Keen Smell or Keen Hearing and Smell trait
{@b Slot:} Head
You have replaced or modified your nose with that of a creature with keen smell. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

item.name: Oversized Arms
entries: {@b Donor:} Giant
{@b Slot:} Arms

You have replaced your arms with a giant's massive limbs. Your melee attacks gain Reach if they did not have it already. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws you make to maintain your grip on objects.

item.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Tail attack
{@b Slot:} External

You surgically attach a muscular, prehensile tail to your body and wire its nerves to your own. You can use your tail to make unarmed strikes, and can use Dexterity instead of Strength for its attack and damage rolls. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Additionally, you can hold and manipulate objects and weapons with your tail, but you can't make attacks with weapons held by your tail or wield a shield with your tail and gain its benefits.
